column1: What criteria do you use for acceptance into your programs?
column2: evaluation process for applications is extremely complex, taking into account all the materials submitted with the application. Grade point average (GPA), GRE scores, TOEFL (for international students), letters of recommendation, and statement of purpose all play a role. First, the UCSD Graduate Admissions Office evaluates each application to determine whether or not their minimum standards for admission have been met. Then the CSE Department does a more thorough evaluation in a committee consisting of several faculty members. Sometimes the committee must draw on the experience of the faculty at-large to make an informed decision.

column1: How do I choose whether to apply to the MS or the PhD program?
column2: The answer to this question depends upon your individual career goals. Our PhD program is designed for students interested in research in computer science and computer engineering. The program prepares individuals for a career in academia as a professor at a research university or liberal arts college, or as a researcher in an industry or government research laboratory. The program typically takes 4-6 years to complete.

column1: What weights are attached to grades, work experience, personal statements, and other application details?
column2: The Admissions Committee looks at each application as a whole and attempts to assess the individual qualities of each applicant. Grades are the most important factor, and all admitted students are well-qualified academically. Beyond grades, however, CSE seeks applicants with a variety of interesting and compelling non-academic attributes -- for example, prior involvement in CSE, creativity, extra curricular activities, and strong communication skills

column1: How do I choose whether to apply to the MS or the PhD program?
column2: The MS program is designed for individuals who are interested in further developing their knowledge and skill base in a rigorous academic program in preparation for either a PhD program or a professional position. With the diverse interests and goals of our students in mind, the program offers a flexible curriculum with either a research (thesis) track or a comprehensive exam. Our average MS student completes the program within 2 years.

column1: How do I apply for Financial Aid?
column2: Please contact the DIU Office of Student Financial Aid for complete information on types of assistance for undergraduates.

column1: Is there a minimum GPA for an application to be considered?
column2: There is no minimum GPA to apply, and there is no automatic admission or denial based on GPA. Everyone who has met the application requirements will be considered.  However, admission is competitive, and admitted students have strong grades.  In general, competitive applicants typically have grades of 3.5 and higher in related math, science, CSE, and English courses, with strong grades overall -- but there is no exact formula determining what grades will be competitive. Speak to a CSE advisor if you have concerns or questions about your grades.

column1: Minimum GPA for CSE admission test?
column2: There is no minimum GPA to apply, and there is no automatic admission or denial based on GPA. Everyone who has met the application requirements will be considered.  However, admission is competitive, and admitted students have strong grades.  In general, competitive applicants typically have grades of 3.5 and higher in related math, science, CSE, and English courses, with strong grades overall -- but there is no exact formula determining what grades will be competitive. Speak to a CSE advisor if you have concerns or questions about your grades.

column1: Are there special considerations for International Students?
column2: International students are considered for admissions.

column1: Does CSE have any special admission programs for minority or female students?
column2: No. All applicants are reviewed and admitted on the same standards. It is illegal to consider race or gender in any admissions or hiring decisions for any program at any public school in the State of Washington. No preference is given to anyone based on race or gender.The department offers targeted recruiting and support opportunities for certain groups of students to help ensure students from all backgrounds are aware of the CSE program and feel welcome. CSE strongly believes in the educational value of bringing together capable students from a variety of backgrounds and therefore makes special efforts to encourage underrepresented students, such as those from minority backgrounds and women, to become aware of what the department offers and what each of them, as individuals, can offer the field of computer science.

column1: My bachelor's degree isn't in CS. What kind of background should I have before applying to the program?
column2: To be considered for admission to any of our graduate programs, students usually have a bachelors degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related discipline like electrical engineering. Occasionally applicants with degrees in fields such as mathematics or physics are considered for admission to the program, especially if they have some computer science background, such as a CS minor. In special circumstances, alternative undergraduate preparation will be considered (e.g., a biology major may be appropriate for a student interested in the application of information and computer science to biological problems, such as bioinformatics).

column1: Do undergraduate students have the opportunity to participate in research?
column2: Yes.  Many undergraduates participate in faculty research, either to complete Honors requirements or for personal enrichment. Research experience is strongly recommended if you are considering graduate school. The department also encourages you to participate in other activities outside the classroom. This includes co-ops and internships, study abroad, and part-time employment.

column1: Is there any program named CIS  ?
column2: yes, Computer and Information Technology.

column1: How many undergraduates do you admit to the major?
column2: Currently, around 490 students per year are accepted into the CSE department. This includes both Computer Science and Computer Engineering.  The CSE Admissions Committee reviews all applications together, so both majors are equally competitive.

column1: How do I choose whether to apply to the MS or the PhD program?
column2: The answer to this question depends upon your individual career goals. Our PhD program is designed for students interested in research in computer science and computer engineering. The program prepares individuals for a career in academia as a professor at a research university or liberal arts college, or as a researcher in an industry or government research laboratory. The program typically takes 4-6 years to complete.

column1: Does CSE offer any scholarships?
column2: Yes, we have a limited number of departmental scholarships available to current CSE majors.

column1: How many semester in a year?
column2: Three semester in a year: Spring, Summer  and  Fall.

column1: How many times admission in a year?
column2: Three semester in a year: Spring, Summer  and  Fall.

column1: who is  Associate Head CSE?

column1: If I am not admitted the first time, can I apply again?
column2: A CSE advisor can help you decide whether reapplying makes sense.  For students who we encourage to reapply, an advisor can discuss previous applications, interpret feedback from the admissions committee if applicable, and recommend next steps for a possible reapplication. Additionally, all CSE applicants should explore alternative computing-related majors to determine a plan in case they are not admitted to the department.

column1: My GPA is not on the 4.0 scale, so how will it be evaluated?
column2: Many institutions, particularly those outside of the US educational system, do not grade students on a 4.0 GPA scale. Our faculty is familiar with the higher educational systems of countries all over the world and evaluates an applicant's academic performance within that individual's local context.

column1: Can I pursue a double major if I major in computer science?
column2: One of the key advantages of a large research institution like the DIU is the extensive cross-department collaboration and the broad range of subjects offered.  CSE values enabling you to explore subjects outside of the department.

column1: If I am accepted into CSE, can I defer admission? Can I attend part-time?
column2: Due to the high demand for the CSE program, admission is offered only for the quarter for which you apply. You may not defer your admission or save a space in the department while not taking CSE courses. The department offers a full-time, daytime program. If you are admitted to the program, plan on pursuing your degree on a full-time basis. Some exceptions may be considered for extenuating circumstances.

column1: Is there any opportunity for improving result?
column2: Of course, but you will have to pay the full course fee in that course.

column1: What is part time job ?
column2: Many of our MS students complete their degrees part-time, but working on the degree part-time can double or triple the time required to complete it. Students do not petition for half-time attendance (6 units or fewer per quarter) until they have been accepted into the CSE program.

column2: minimum GPA atleast 2.0 in subjects

column1: Does the Library have computers, wireless access for use?
column2: Yes, there are computers at every floor adjacent to the circulation desk for database search, preparation of assignments and internet browsing. Wi-Fi accessibility is available to whole library premises.

column1: Is food and drink allowed in the Library?
column2: No. there is no scope to take food and drinks inside the library premises.

column1: Are there designated loud places and quiet spaces in the Library?
column2: No, but there are quieter and louder places located throughout the Library depending on user need (individual users tend to prefer quiet; while groups congregating for study or socializing appreciate being able to converse normally). The Library recognizes the need for both. We simply encourage users to be respectful of others at all times. Please talk with a Library staff member if you have a question or concern.

column1: Does the Library have group/study rooms?
column2: Yes, the Library has a large group/study section on the fifth floor where approximately 100 users can accommodate at once.

column1: How do I find out what books, journals, magazines, project report etc. are in the Library?
column2: The entire collection is searchable via the library catalog, which is available on- or off-campus from the library homepage. Put your cursor on ‚ÄúLibrary Catalog‚Äù in search bar from the library homepage, then you can search by Keyword (default), Author, Title, subject, ISBN, etc. An item with a status ‚ÄúAvailable‚Äù in the Catalog should be available for check out from the shelves.To search books please go to the following link: http://koha.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd

column1: Can I hold any item?
column2: You can also reserve an item by selecting  hold option through which you will enjoy priority to check out or borrow on those materials. To hold a book you need to first log in with your Library ID & Password. Then you can "Place hold" on items which are already checked out to another.

column1: Where to download e-books?
column2: To download e-books please go the the following link. You need to login with your e-book identity and password to search or download e-books. http://e-books.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd

column1: What do I need to borrow items from the Library?
column2: Daffodil International University faculty, students and staff must present a valid library membership to check out library materials.

column1: How long can I check out Library items?
column2: Faculty members can check out total 7 books for one semester (120 days) Reference and continuing resources for 15 days, DVDs, and CDs for 5 days. Items can be renewed once if they are not on hold for other users. Students can check out 5 books for reading within the library, Project reports for 15 days, and audiovisual materials and magazines for 5 days. Items can be renewed once if they are not on hold for other users.

column1: Where do I return Library items?
column2: When the Library is open, please return items of any type to the respective Circulation Desk from where, you had borrow/check-out of that particular item.

column1: How can I get an item that is currently checked out?
column2: Place a hold on a checked-out item via the library catalog at the search page. When the item is returned the Library will contact you via email, and you may check out the item at the Circulation Desk using your ID. If you have any trouble placing a hold, please contact the Library.

column1: Can you tell me who has an item that is currently checked out?
column2: Librarians take patron privacy very seriously. Library records of patrons are private. Library staff cannot tell you who is using, or has used, a library item. Library staff cannot disclose who is using or has used a library item, or who has requested information on a particular topic, except to a person inquiring about their own record, or law enforcement officers with warrants for specific information.

column1: What are the fines for overdue items? What happens if I fail to return an item checked out in my name?
column2: The Library sends automated email notices when items are overdue but does not charge daily fines for overdue items. Faculty members and administrative personnel will be charged per day according to‚Äã Library Policy against every item (Except holidays).

column1: What happens if an item checked out in my name is lost or damaged?
column2: All items checked out to you are your responsibility until returned. If an item is lost or damaged, you must have replaced the item by the same as it was during the check-out. Your library account will be blocked until charges are paid. Outstanding Library charges, as with any other unresolved student fees, may prevent you from graduating, registering, transferring, receiving transcripts, withdrawing, or transferring credits to another institution.

column1: I am a daffodil International University student in a graduate program. What do I have to do to submit my thesis to the Library?
column2: The Library enters copies of all completed graduate student project papers/theses into its permanent collection. Students should submit their project paper/thesis to their supervisor and library will collect these from the supervisor and preserved at 3rd floor of the library.

column1: How can I find out when a library item is due?
column2: You can find the due date for any item by looking at its record in the catalog. By logging into your Library Account, you can see the due dates of items you have borrowed.

column1: How many books may I have checked out at one time?
column2: Please check the circulation rule.

column1: What is the role of DSA Office to the students? (generally asked by fresh Student)
column2: Office of the Director of Students  Affairs is a professional body, dedicated to the social, psychological, ethical and cognitive development and well-being of all DIU students. It also works collaboratively with respected faculty members to implement the university educational and developmental mission. In addition to it, the Office of the DSA looks after all club activities, foundation classes, orientation of newly admitted students, psychosocial support. It also organizes trainings on positive behavioral changes, national-international collaboration programs, award programs, and coordinates the unique course named Art of Living.

column1: Is membership needed to get service from DSA Office?
column2: NO. If you have a valid DIU ID card, DSA office is officially responsible to help you within its working area.

column1: How can we get notification about DSA Office?
column2: To reach every single student we are using some virtual platform like, Facebook, DIU authorized mail, DIU Forum, official website etc besides direct physical communication or telecommunication. Website: http://dsa.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/ FB page: https://www.facebook.com/diudsa/

column1: How can we join with club activities?
column2: Students those who are interested to join club activities, are highly encouraged to contact with DSA provided platform (mail, social media, website, contact number) or directly to our office location, #Level 04, Daffodil Tower, Sobhanbag, Dhaka

column1: If we want to open/form a new club what should be the proceedings?
column2: First of all you need to form a group of students at (least 20) with a faculty member as a proposed moderator. After that, an official proposal has to be sent with club details: (why needed, student benefit, University benefit etc) within the prescribed protocol including club constitution.

column2: To get update about Foundation class (Every Season/Semester) please keep your eyes on our regular mail, Social page, and website.

column1: What is DIU Start up market and how we can involve ourselves here?
column2:
DIU start up market is a student run bazaar initiated in order to help students who have an insight vision to be an entrepreneur in future. That's why we called it an Entrepreneur‚'s Lab.
 
 Generally it happens two days in a week where interested students had to pay a minimum subscription charge of BDT 300, then we provide necessary logistics support to make it happen. For continuous update you can keep in touch with Start up market social page: https://www.facebook.com/DIUStartupMarket/?ref=bookmarks&qsefr=1

column1: Permanent Campus ?
column2: Academic activities and students enrollment have already been started at the permanent campus project. The construction will be implemented in four phases and it will have separate academic and administrative infrastructures, residential hall for both students and faculty members, library, Cafeteria, TSC, auditorium, play ground, swimming pool, prayer hall, transport pool, gymnasium, departmental faculty, research center and an ICT center. The permanent campus will be consisting of modern facilities for lectures, meetings, group activities, student organizations social and religious festivals. It will be fully equipped with medical facilities, computer, Science and technological laboratories, performance spaces and many more. DIU envisages turning the campus into Fiber Optic Network and Wifi enabled zone. For ensuring all sorts of facilities there will be on-campus shopping facility. The site for the permanent campus of DIU is situated on about 24.5 acres of land at Ashulia in the serene, calm and quiet, green and open atmosphere and is free from the hustle and bustle of the city. It will be the largest campus in private universities. The classrooms are fully equipped with state of the art technology. http://news.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=75:foundation-stone-laying-ceremony-of-diu-observed&catid=34

column1: About Quality Education
column2: DIU is specially committed to quality education. Quality is ensured through regular classes, strict examinations and other academic and administrative measures. http://daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/about/at-a-glance/history.html

column1: Qualified Academicians
column2: Our faculty members are highly qualified with brilliant academic backgrounds. Many have vast experiences in teaching and research. http://faculty.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd

column1: Academic Diversity
column2: The essence of the university is academic diversity. It offers a variety of programs under the Faculty of Science and Information Technology, Faculty of Business and Economics, the Faculty of Humanities & Social Science and the Faculty of Medical & Health Science. There are seventeen departments in the university now and the university is ardent to increase the number of subjects to meet the market demand of current competitive world.http://faculty.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd

column1: Awards & Recognition from Various National & International Levels ?
column2: Daffodil International University (DIU) has achieved lot of Awards from both National & International levels. Among the International Awards, achievement of ASOCIO 2018 ICT Education Award, Merit Award in WITSA 2017 Global ICT Excellence Awards by the largest international ICT organization, Merit Award in WITSA 2014 Global ICT Excellence Awards, World Information Technology and Services Alliance (WITSA), World Quality Commitment (WQC) Award-2010, World Congress of IT (WCIT) 2017 Merit Award, Global Inclusion Award 2017, Asia's most inspiring Nation Builder Award, Golden Star Academic & Educational Excellence Award, Amity Global Academic Excellence Award, Asia‚Äôs Best Business School Award basing on its extraordinary performance and remarkable contribution in higher education sector are some significant examples. http://photo.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/displayimage.php?album=24&pos=19

column1: Efficient Administration
column2: Efficient administration of DIU is capable of solving problems quickly and effectively. The Vice Chancellor, Dean, Advisor, Registrar, Exam Controller and Departmental Heads take care of administrative and academic affairs. http://daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/admin/top-management

column1: ICT Facilities ?
column2: DIU is the first complete digital university in Bangladesh for technology-based education and operation with such facilities as computer labs, education ERP and WIFI on campus. http://forum.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/index.php/topic,1148.0.html

column1: IT Expertise Recognition ?
column2: DIU accorded Championship in IBBL IUT 3rd National ICT Fest-2011 in Hardware and Software Project Showcasing where a total of 18 projects of different public & private universities took part. http://news.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=87:robotick-project&catid=34 This university became champion in IUBAT-Inter University Programming Contest 2010 The DIU team became CHAMPION, as well as got ‚ÄúAward of excellence‚Äù for solving all problems. 8 private universities named AIUB, BRAC, DIU, NSU, UIU, USTC, SUB and IUBAT attended the contest.

column1: Wifi covered University ?
column2: DIU is a university with Wifi coverage. Faculty members as well as students enjoy Wifi connectivity inside the campuses to be connected with internet at a wink.

column1: Virtual University ?
column2: DIU is fully automated and all its activities are done or recorded in the Virtual University. Every student and guardian can see any information relating to payment, admission, results, course offering and others. Students registration is completely online. http://vus.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd:200/login

column1: Lab facilities ?
column2: The laboratories of DIU are considered as the country's best. There are digital labs in all departments. Departments under the Faculty of Science and Information Technology have their own specialized laboratories for practical. https://daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/article/lab-and-amenities

column1: Ranking and Recognition ?
column2: DIU is a top ranking university in Bangladesh. It has achieved many national and international recognition and rankings based on its standard and quality education. https://daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/article/ranking

column1: Admission and Examination ?
column2: Admission is taken in a transparent way and the rules of University Grants Commission. Examinations are also conducted in a strict fashion.

column1: International Collaboration ?
column2: DIU has versatile networking worldwide that assist cross cultural education and students exchanges.

column1: Scholarship facilities ?
column2: https://daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/scholarship/diu-scholarship

column1: Email Facility ?
column2: https://www.google.com/a/diu.edu.bd/

column1: Location ?
column2: http://daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/images/map/small.jpg

column1: Mode of payment ?
column2: Its mode of payment is convenient. Students can pay their fees in several installments. Installments may be paid through CDM.

column1: One student One Laptop
column2:
DIU is proud of its students and all the time think good of them. For empowering the students ICT knowledge, management has taken the initiative to provide Laptop to every student. With a view to making every student of DIU dynamic, the university has already initiated ‚ÄúOne Student One Laptop‚Äù project, to which students also responded positively.
 http://laptop.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/

column1: Academic Programs
column2:
DIU has continuously been introducing subjects which have market value. An expert team is analyzing different effective subjects for new students on a regular basis.
 
 Faculty of Business & Entrepreneurship
 
 Faculty of Science and Information Technology
 
 Faculty of Engineering
 
 Faculty of Humanities & Social Science
 
 Faculty of Allied Health Science

column1: Co-curricular activities
column2:
It has a lot of co-curricular activities for the students performed under different clubs. Lab & Amenities
 
 Orientations, Reception, Farewells are regular programs organized by all departments separately.http://news.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=94:orientation-program-of-dept-of-pharmacy-held&catid=34
 
 DIU Debating Club (DIUDC) became Champion at the Grand final of the National Debate Championship 2011 organized by the Jahangirnagar University Debate Organization.http://news.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=80:national-debate-championship-2011-&catid=34

column1: DIU Forum
column2:
Faculty members and students can take part in different forums expressing their thoughts and opinions on any subject. Forum is an effective board to solving problem, getting answer & sharing productive & beneficial ideas.
 http://forum.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/

column1: Convocation and Foundation
column2:
DIU holds its convocation regularly to award certificates among its graduates. It also celebrates foundation day every year.
 http://convocation.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/ & http://fd.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/

column1: Auditorium
column2:
An auditorium with the facility of modern audio-visual equipments has been constructed in the main campus of DIU having sitting arrangement of almost 500 people. The auditorium is regularly used to conduct all seminars, symposium, cultural programs and many other co-curricular programs. 
 Auditorium

column1: Student Accommodation
column2:
DIU has arrangement of residence for female students. The accommodation provided upon requirements of the female students. DIU ensures comfortable stay, well environment and security in the resident.
 
 http://daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/academics-info/facilities/hostel-facilities.html

column1: Career Development Center (CDC)
column2: CDC is performing a pivotal role to ensure job and internship placement for the students of Daffodil International University. CDC is also responsible for arranging workshop, training programs, seminar, symposium, job fair in intra-university and inter-university level on regular basis for the professional development of students. http://cdc.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/

column1: Research Center
column2: To inspire and to involve the faculty members and students in research activities, DIU has setup three (03) separate research centers under each faculty, namely (i) Bureau of Business and Economics Research, (ii) Research Center for Science & Information Technology, and (iii) Research Center for Humanities & Social sciences. http://research.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/

column1: Publications
column2: In DIU, the Faculty of Business & Economics and the Faculty of Science & Information Technology publish two separate biannual research-based journals. These journals contain highly scholarly research conducted by the renowned researchers and scholars of home and abroad. The faculty of Humanities and Social Science is going to publish a journal very soon.

column1: Sports
column2:
11th South Asian Games: Two students named Mr. Sun and Mr. Moon respectively, from the Department of TE won the Gold medals in the 11th South Asian Games in Karata Event. DIU family is really proud of these townie brothers who had brought this significant success for Bangladesh as well as for DIU.
 DIU Cricket Team: DIU team made us proud when they experienced a comprehensive victory in the Inter-University Champions Trophy by defeating ULAB!!
 34th National Athletics Championships: The vigorous athletes of Daffodil International University showed an outstanding performance in the 34th National Athletics Championships of Bangladesh, held in the year 2009. DIU achieved 3rd position in this national event with 4 gold and 3 bronze. The Gold Medal Winners of DIU were: Ms. Hazera Akhter (Shot Put), Mr. Enamul Haque (5000m), Ms. Hazera Akhter (Javelin Throw) & Ms. Sathi Parveen (High Jump). A total of 692 athletes -- 531 men and 161 women -- from 81 teams took part in the meet.

column1: Online Teachers Evaluation
column2: In DIU, all the students evaluate their course teachers from anywhere from online. It is a compulsory process. Online evaluation ensures transparency of the evaluation. Teachers feel accountability to enhance their status so that they can get good marking from the students‚Äô part. Ultimately, this process increases quality education. http://erp.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd

column1: Forum, Blog
column2: Forum http://forum.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd & Blog http://blog.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/ are two exquisite footings of DIU for sharing ideas, information & knowledge between teachers & students.

column1: Campus TV
column2: The university has introduced Campus TV http://campustv.ac/ to increase interaction and activities among its students and teachers.

column1: Online Notice Board
column2: As a Digital University, DIU publishes all notices and announcements on Online Notice Board. As a result, all DIU students can get notices and announcements from any corner of the world and remain up to date.

column1: DIU Medical Center
column2: DIU established a Medical Center in the Campus for the health care of DIU students. DIU students are able to get free treatment from DIU Medical Center. DIU believes ‚Äúgood health is the foundation of progress.‚Äù

column1: Fresher‚Äôs Welcome
column2: DIU receives its future Leaders and Scholars with a warm and fresh welcome through Orientation program. DIU treats all students as its asset and from the first day at campus DIU ensures all their necessary things.

column1: Guardian Communication
column2: For the betterment of the students, DIU communicates with the Guardians and informs them about their students, if needed.

column1: Special counseling for weaker students
column2: If it is identified that few students are not getting marks up to satisfactory level, DIU faculty members support them, especially to improve their performance.

column1: Religious Events
column2: DIU observes all religious programs and arranges various religious events (iftar party, Miladunnabi, Sarwaswati puja, X-mass, for example) in the campus. It develops a brotherhood among the students and teachers in the campus and outside the campus as well.

column1: Digital Class Rooms
column2: As the first digital university in Bangladesh, DIU introduced digital class rooms for making the students familiar with modern technologies.

column1: One stop services
column2: To solve the problems of students and to make a friendly educational environment in campus DIU started one stop services. Where every student can get the solution of multiple problems from one booth.

column1: Gymnasium
column2: DIU has established a large gymnasium in the campus. The gymnasium is furnished with modern equipment. Students can take exercise here for their good health

column1: Financial Aid & Scholarships
column2: https://daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/scholarship/diu-scholarship

column1: How can I find the contact numbers of a teacher/officer?
column2:
Visit the following link of DIU website 
 Officers: https://daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/administration
 
 Teachers: http://faculty.daffodilvarsity.edu.bd/

column1: What is the process of teaching evaluation?
column2: Login to student portal and update your profile. After that, fill the teaching evaluation form and submit it.

column1: How to check payment ledger from student portal?
column2: Login to student portal and click ‚Äúpayment‚Äù option for student payment ledger and payment scheme.

column1: Can I meet with my course teacher other than class period?
column2: Yes, you can meet with your teacher during the counseling hours.

column1: Where can I find information about insurance?
column2: Contact Mr. Md. Zubayarul Islam, Administrative Officer.Mobile: 01847140055

column1: How can I login the google classroom?
column2: First download the classroom apps from the google play store. Install the app to your mobile. Login by providing your g-mail ID and password.

column1: what is the deadlines for applying at DIU ?
column2: Pls follow the deadlines url (Click Here)

column1: What are the tuition fees of Daffodil International University for study
column2: For local Students For International Students

column1: How can I Change/ Add/Drop course after the registration?
column2: After the registration, you may be able to Change/Add/Drop any course within 7 days after the last date of the registration. Contact your batch coordinator.

column1: How can I complete my course registration in the semester? (For existing students)
column2: Collect your account clearance by paying the registration fees in the Accounts Section.Submit it (keep a photocopy) to the batch coordinator in your department. He/she will complete your course registration as per the rule.After the completion, you have to check the student portal to confirm the completion of course registration.

column1: How do I complete course registration in the semester? (For new Students)
column2: Collect your account clearance by paying the registration fees/Admission fees in the Accounts Section. 2. Submit the filled up StudentInsurance Form (given during the admission) and the account clearanceto the Coordination Officer of the Department Office. 3. When the registration is done by the department Office, you have to check the student portal to confirm your registration.

column1: What can I do to drop the semester? (before registration)
column2: In case of specific reason, if you could not pay your registration fees and did not complete the registration, then you must drop the semester in the student portal.

column1: What can I do to drop my semester? (after registration)
column2: Write an application (describing specific reason) to the Dean through Head of the Department within 2 weeks of the last date of registration. 2. If Head and Dean approve, then you need to submit the copy of the approval to the Registrar Office for final approval. 3. One week later you need to check the student portal and/or contact the department office to confirm the semester drop.

column1: I am a student of previous syllabus. Shall I do my registration with previous course code or I will register with new course code?
column2: Student of previous syllabus can do registration with previous syllabus with an application to the Head of the department.

column1: What can I do for registration when the registration date is over?
column2: Please follow the instructions given in the notice board and contact to the department office for further help.

column1: I have already dropped three or more semesters (without informing). Now I want to continue my study.
column2: Please follow the instructions of re-admission given in the notice board and contact to the department office.

column1: How to take extra courses in a semester?
column2: Students may apply to the Dean through Head of the departmentdescribing the name and credits of courses to be taken.

column1: How I can extend registration duration for more than six years?
column2: Submit an application (describing the reason) to the Registrar through Head and Dean. A draft transcript need to be attached with the application.

column1: How can I resolve result block?
column2: Clear your previous dues 2.Contact with Registrar Office/Exam Office for resolving of blocked result.

column1: What is the process of doing dual-major?
column2: If you want to do dual-major you need to write an application to the Head of the Department. 2. The co-ordination officer will provide guidelines for the student which s/he will have to follow. 3. In order to do dual-major a student needs to complete 1 elective course, 7 courses from the first major and 5 courses from the second major.

column1: What is the fees of improvement exam?
column2: The student has to pay 40% of the course fees to attend the mid-term improvement exam and 60% of the course fees for the finalexam improvement.

column1: How can I get my admit card for Mid Term and Final Exams?
column2: Pay your instalment (fees) and collect your exam clearance/admit card showing the money receipt from the Accounts Section. You need to preserve the exam clearance/admit card for sitting the exam.

column1: How can I sit in the improvement exam?
column2: Collect the Form of improvement exam from the department office and fill up the Form. 2.Pay required fees for improvement exam in the accounts section and get the clearance. 3. Then you submit the form to the department office. The department office will send the form to the relevant teacher.

column1: How can I select a Supervisor for internship?
column2: Contact your Head of the Department who will assign your supervisor for internship & thesis.

column1: How can I get my semester results from website?
column2: Browse DIU website to find the option of ‚ÄòVirtual University‚Äô. Click &enter your ID in the Academic Result box.When you press enter, your results will be displayed.

column1: How can I get the cumulative results (CGPA) of all the courses that I have completed?
column2: To collect draft transcript only before completion of all courses, you need to pay Tk.50/- to Accounts Section. 2. Go to the exam section and fill out the application form for draft transcript. 3.Collect your transcript when it is ready.

column1: I have two exams in same time slot. Can I attend the improvement of the missed exam without fee?
column2: You can attend the improvement exam without fee in case of overlapping of exams.

column1: Do I have to attend a minimum number of classes to attend the examinations?
column2: Minimum of 60% of the classes you must attend.

column1: What is the minimum CGPA to get the certificate?
column2: The minimum CGPA is 2.50 to get your degree certificate.

column1: Is there any eligibility to attend the final Improvement Exam?
column2: Students those who got ‚ÄúGrade B‚Äù or less may apply for improvement

column1: Transcript/certificate/concern letter, etc. related FAQ
How I can take concern letter/ testimonial for job purpose?
column2: Write an application to the Head of the Department (format given in the office/notice board) along with money receipt of the payment of tk 50. Please write your parents name in the application and in the back side of the money receipt.

column1: How I get Internship letter?
column2: You must complete all courses to start internship while maintaining at least CGPA of 2.50. 2. Collect internship form from the department office. Fill up the form and get the required signatures. 3. Pay fees and take Accounts clearance 4.Submit the form to department office together with clearance receipt.

column1: When I will be allowed for provisional certificate?
column2: After the completion of all required credits for the degree, you will be allowed for provisional certificate until the subsequent convocation ceremony.

column1: How can I withdraw academic transcripts/ certificate?
column2: Collect form from DIU exam office and fill-up the form and submit to the exam section.

column1: How can I get a recommendation letter?
column2: For Recommendation Letter,you have to pay TK. 50 to Accounts section. Write your father‚Äôs and mother‚Äôs name backside of the money receipt.Then submit an application to Head of the Department. Attach the money receipt along with the application. (submit the soft copy of the draft recommendation letter, if any)

column1: How I will get a concern letter.
column2: For Concern Letter, you have to pay TK. 50 to Accounts section. Write your father‚Äôs and mother‚Äôs name backside of the money receipt.Then submit an application to Head of the Department. Attach the money receipt along with the application.

column1: How can I get my email password? (For new students)
column2: You can get your email ID and password from the online notice board and the departmental notice board.

column1: How can I solve the Email password problem?
column2: You need to pay Tk20/- to Account section and fill-up the register book from the department office for specific problem.Department office will send an e-mail to IT section to solve the problem and then inform you the solution.

column1: I cannot login in the student portal. How can I get access to the student portal?
column2: The detailed information regarding the reset option of student portal password is given in the notice board of the department. Please follow the instructions.

column1: How can I get my class routine of the semester?
column2: You can find your class routine in the departmental notice board, online notice board and in your email.

column1: I have lost my ID card. What can I do now?
column2: At first, you have to go to the Police Station to do a General Dairy (GD). Submit the photocopy of the GD to the Admission Section. The Admission Section will give you the further instructions.

column1: Where can I get my scholarship/waiver information?
column2: You can get your scholarship/waiver information from the Registrar Office.

column1: When is the payment date?
column2: The date of payment will be notified through online notice board and through the mail.

column1: How much do we need to pay in second (before mid-term) and third (before final) installment?
column2: You have already paid the registration fees in the beginning of the semester. Now, multiply the no of credits you have registered in current semester with per credit tuition fees for your program. The result is the total amount you have to pay in two equal parts in the time of mid-term and final exams respectively. You can also askthe respective officers of the Account Section and/or you can check the Ledger inthe Students‚Äô Portal.

column1: How may I reserve class room for extra class?
column2: Come to the department office and contact with coordination officer for booking class room.
